It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Rindera tetraspis is typically found in moist, sandy soils in open habitats such as dunes and coastal areas. It is a relatively rare species, often growing in isolated populations along the Atlantic coast of North America.
